MEDIA CLOUD
Explore Subscriber Lifecycle Management Features

Subscriber Lifecycle Management is built on the Salesforce lightning platform. It provides the shortest path for Media companies to digitize their customer facing operations by providing capabilities that help reduce implementation time and project risk, while also delivering superior digital experiences to end customers.

How does Subscriber Lifecycle Management help to reduce implementation time? It provides a bunch of ready-made components that demonstrate how to use Salesforce assets effectively in various business processes. You shorten your learning curve and achieve an optimal solution with minimal effort. Subscriber Lifecycle Management is built on best practices gained across many projects, so you benefit from our accumulated learning.

The core elements of Subscriber Lifecycle Management include the following:

Core Elements of Subscriber Lifecycle Management
CORE ELEMENT OF SUBSCRIBER LIFECYCLE MANAGEMENT	DETAILS
Attract	
Audience Segmentation with Media Cloud Unified Audience Profile
B2C and B2B Demand Generation (Marketing Cloud)
Lead Nurturing (Marketing Cloud)
Personalized Journeys (Marketing Cloud, Media Cloud)

Acquire	
Self service or assisted catalog browsing “Browse and Buy” (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Subscriber Journeys (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Order Capture and Activation (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Digital Commerce (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)

Service	
Customer 360 Guided Service Flows (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Media Call Center Omnichannel Service (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Live Chat and Chat Bots (Service Cloud Add-On)
Self Service Guided Flows (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Knowledge Base and Forums (Experience Cloud)

Engage	
Prediuct Subscriber behavior and churcn (Media Cloud - CRM Analytics Add-on)
Upsell - Cross-sell (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management)
Content Recommendations (Media Cloud - Subscriber Lifecycle Management + Partners)
Gamification and rewards (Loyalty Cloud for Media)

Retain	
Loyalty Management (Loyalty Cloud for Media)
Personalized Retention and Winback (Marketing Cloud)

Following are the key benefits and capabilities of Subscriber Lifecycle Management:

Maximize subscriber lifetime value with Salesforce.
Monetize audiences faster.
Attract, convert, and onboard subscribers quickly to drive content engagement.
Deliver omnichannel customer care.
Leverage digital channels to simplify service, deflect calls, and serve subscribers on any device and channel from anywhere.
Measure and optimize for growth.
Surface timely, actionable, and predictive insights to streamline acquisition, personalized service and retention.
Drive retention and loyalty.
Personalize the entire subscriber lifecycle, design data-driven retention journeys and curate loyalty programs.
Out-of-the-box, Subscriber Lifecycle Management includes integrations with the Stripe payment gateway, Google address validation APIs, and Industries Order Management.
In addition, Subscriber Lifecycle Management also offers the flexibility to integrate with other Salesforce products, such as Marketing Cloud and Loyalty Cloud.

Here's what you get in your Subscriber Lifecycle Management org.

A data model. Subscriber Lifecycle Management uses the Vlocity Communications data model. See Vlocity Communications Data Model.

A reference product model and product configurations so you can run the customer journeys. See Subscriber Lifecycle Management Product Model.

Several of the most commonly used business processes. See What Can You Do With Subscriber Lifecycle Management?.

Separate user interfaces for anonymous users, logged in subscribers, and customer support representatives:

Web shop - for anonymous users to browse products and create an account. See Use Subscriber Lifecycle Management as an Anonymous User.

Self-care - for subscribers to view and manage their account. See Use Subscriber Lifecycle Management as a Logged in Subscriber.

Agent console - for agents to perform various actions for subscribers. See Use Subscriber Lifecycle Management as an Agent.

The use of the Digital Commerce API SDK. If you want to enhance the UI or implement your own UI, the SDK methods are already available to be consumed. See Digital Commerce documentation.

A reference implementation of an Omni-Channel shopping cart.

A reference implementation of customer interaction history.

A library of core components that are used to implement the customer journeys. See Core Components for Subscriber Lifecycle Management.

To use these features of Subscriber Lifecycle Management, you must request an org. See Get Started with Subscriber Lifecycle Management.

Subscriber Lifecycle Management Product Model
Subscriber Lifecycle Management comes with a set of reference product models that are based on industry best practices. The objective of such a reference product model is to help you to understand how the media and entertainment industry, especially the pay TV, satellite TV, and OTT service providers, can model their catalogs. These reference product models also help you to understand how to use Subscriber Lifecycle Management capabilities efficiently. 
What Can You Do With Subscriber Lifecycle Management?
Subscriber Lifecycle Management provides different interfaces for different user personas. So customer service representatives (CSRs or agents) use a different interface and see different information compared to subscribers and anonymous users. However, many of the same tasks are performed by subscribers and by agents when managing a subscriber's account, subscriptions, devices, and cases. Subscriber Lifecycle Management lets you use a common set of features and components to provide a similar functionality to subscribers, agents, or other users, while ensuring that each persona retains their own distinctive views and options.
How Can You Customize Your Subscriber Lifecycle Management Implementation?
While Subscriber Lifecycle Management is designed to get you started quickly with minimal configuration, you could customize some parts of the solution to fit your own requirements. Given that Subscriber Lifecycle Management uses standard Salesforce features and functionality, you can customize many of the components.
Subscriber Lifecycle Management Personas and Required Permission Sets
Subscriber Lifecycle Management provides sample personas to enable you to fully experience the features and functionality offered by the Subscriber Lifecycle Management application.
Subscriber Lifecycle Management Known Limitations
Here are some of the current known limitations of Subscriber Lifecycle Management.
